review: Terrific location, amazingly friendly staff !! Lovely food, wonderful room with balcony looking out to lake Garda and the surrounding hills. Almost pedestrian surroundings eliminating traffic noise and the inevitable screaming scooters. Sunbathed all day on the private relaxing terrace next to the cute ducks and watching the boats idling passed.  Talking boat trips, we took one around the lake on a hydrofoil to a few of the other harbours, towns and ports......was terrific but Sirmione where the hotel flaminia is situated is in my opinion far superior.   Food in the local restaurants is spectacularly good. A little pricey but actually I didn't mind paying because it was of excellent quality and always beautifully presented by the extremely polite and professional Italian…

title: Great hotel
review: We had a good stay at flaminia hotel. Service is good and the staff is friendly.  The terras is a great spot to relax and take a swim. Location in the centre of sirmione is very nice. All facilities are close by.

title: Wonderful holiday
review: We stayed here with our three small boys in one room. The room had a double bed, a bunk bed ( converted from a lounge) and our four year old slept in a cot which was a good size for him. The floor of the hotel we stayed in had just been renovated which probably influenced our good impression. We found everything modern and clean. The room is not large but we found it fine and you could see the lake from the balcony. The town is charming with cobblestone streets and bustling with people, shops and lots of restaurants. The staff at the hotel were very friendly and the breakfasts in a room overlooking the lake were extensive with lots of choice and excellent coffee and hot chocolate prepared fresh by the staff as required ( rather than a pot of brewed) which we much prefer. We went…

title: Total relax
review: Nice comfortable rooms, but we did not spend too much time there. The decking is where the views of the lake are, sitting there relaxing with a glass of Spritz (a must try - very refreshing), the staff are very attentative and the food from the Caffe Margarita is superb for a very reasonable cost.

title: Sirmione is lovely and so was the Flaminia Hotel
review: We arrived in Sirmione one afternoon without a reservation.  We asked at several hotels but none appealed to us. At the Flaminia the receptionist cheerfully showed us a large, attractive room with a view of the lake and the little piazza.  She also gave us the bargain rate of 100 Euros.  We ended up staying two nights.  The breakfast was very ample and we liked sitting  on the deck overlooking the lake and watching the boats.

title: Very nice!
review: Very good location in the old town with a deck into Garda lake. The rooms were clean and cosy,  although we had a bad smell in the bathroom that didn't go away even after we complaint. Beside of this incident the staff was very helpful and kind.

title: excellent stay
review: We stayed in Hotel Flaminia for 3 nights in May 14. Our room was facing the back and had a nice view of the Lake. Very quiet! Big room, especially in italian standards. The reception ladies were very helpful and even helped us finding wineries near by! Breakfast was good, nice selection of fresh fruits. The Hotel location is amazing in the centre of Sirmione, plenty of restaurants to choose close by. The terrace over the Lake is nice for pre dinner drink and watching the sunset! I would definately stay here avain.

title: Avoid rooms at back of hotel
review: We stayed in one of the rooms at the back of the hotel (the opposite side to the entrance) and on all but one morning were woken up by the loading and unloading of supplies for the attached restaurant and nearby establishments between 5.30 and 6 am.  It was also quite noisy up until midnight on some days. We had to have the window doors ajar because the air-conditioning system was so noisy and did not appear to work. The room itself was very clean but quite small. Breakfast was quite reasonable with plenty of fresh fruit but a very limited hot selection such as pancakes or boil your own egg. The location was good as you were only a couple of minutes from where the boats left that went all over the lake.  (Do read the boat timetable carefully as out of season some boats only run…

title: Good hotel in a great location
review: We stayed 2 nights in Sirmione. If your driving, park at the tourist information centre on the left just before approaching the gate/draw bridge to Sirmione. You will then get a pass to drive into Sirmione with its narrow streets and lots of tourists which is an event in itself. The parking is actually off peninsula so you will have to drive back out. If your not a confident driver, might be better to walk to the hotel and get the car parking pass before. Nice welcoming staff. The hotel has a little bit of a 70's theme but not offensive. Our room was on the 3rd floor, 39, which was at the side of the hotel but still had a great view of the lake. Very spacious and clean room. Breakfast was good but not amazing. Would stop here again if stopping at Sirmione due to the location.

title: Perfect location in the 'island'
review: We were there last week on may. It was our 4'th times our stay in this hotel. What i really like most from this hotel is the location. Normally they have valet service for the car but last time we have to take care of ourself. Quite limitation breakfast...they should do more. Room are clean and nice especially from the main building. Higher are a better view. Like i say, perfect location and with the right rooms......view are breathtaking. Note, not every rooms are having good view. Good value after all.

title: Perfect location on the lake, and in the centre of Sirmione
review: We had a three night stay in a double room in the Annex to Hotel Flaminia, with a side view to Lake Garda from the small balcony.  The hotel location was excellent, right on the lake shore and in the heart of the old town of Sirmione. We arrived on the direct bus from Verona, and the hotel is easy to find on the short walk from the bus stop. The views across the lake from the restaurant and sun deck were really beautiful, especially in the evenings as the sun set across the lake.  Service in the hotel was good - at reception, in showing us to our room, at breakfast and in the bar.  The breakfasts were ample and with a wide range of fresh, hot and cold food.  Our room was fairly compact, and nicely furnished and decorated in a colourful oriental style. The bathroom was a little…

title: Nice hotel
review: We have just returned from a weeks stay here in a lake view room which was lovely. Light airy room with a good bathroom and a balcony to sit and watch the activities in the lake. Good location right in the centre of the town which is within the walls of the castle. Breakfast was ample although at times the coffee service was a little slow. We spent our time going from town to town either by boat or by car so didn't really spend much time in site. The only thing missing really is a pool for those times when you just want to chill out and relax, great places to eat in the centre and overall a great garda base

title: Nice hotel on Lake Garda
review: We were here in March and it was beautiful 3 days. Hotel is nice and calm. It is located in the old town, near the thermal baths.We arrived by car and even though the hotel is located in the heart of the old town, we were able to park right outside the hotel.

title: Great view of Lake Garda
review: Booked with Bookings.com and specified a lake view. But when I phoned the hotel to ask if they had received my request, they said no, as they do not offer Lake View rooms via 3rd party companies. I asked that if I cancelled with bookings.com and booked a room with a lake view with them, would they do this for the same price? "Yes" Room decor is a little strange but hey what a great view!!

title: Couldn't be more convenient
review: We were delighted with our stay in Hotel Flaminia.  Staff were always helpful, patient and willing to assist with information. They organise parking and have bicycles freely available which was a fun way to see local sights. We had a room overlooking the lake which is quieter than being on the piazza. But even the piazza quietens down around midnight. I am happy to recommend this hotel.

title: Great view from our corner room
review: This hotel is located in the old town, where you get by car only if you have the hotel reservation. The hotel takes your car to the garage. We got a very nice room with a great view to the lake and one to the gardens. The room was well decorated, bathroom spacious and very clean. Breakfast was served on the terrace just above the lake - great! Service was friendly, so there was nothing to complain but the weather! The hotel even had big umbrellas, so they did everything to make your stay a good one!

title: Lovely location, staff and room.
review: Great choice of hotel - the location is amazing.  Lovely view and very convenient for the bus to  Verona and  the train station for  trips to Milan. The staff worked very hard to keep everything clean and running smoothly. Fresh food at breakfast with great service. Lots of restaurants and ice-cream shops on the doorstep. Thanks to all at the hotel.

title: Good hotel with sun deck by the lake
review: The location of this hotel by the lake shore in the old part of Sirmione is great. They have sun beds on a sundeck built on poles in the water, from where stairs lead into the water (although ducks and swans may discourage some people from swimming there) and towels are provided. The restaurant where breakfast was served from 7.30 was adjacent to the sun deck and so we had nice views across the lake at breakfast, which was quite good with bread (especially the rolls with pumpkin seed were very tasty), ham, different types of cheese, yoghurt, cereal, fruit, omelette, tomatos, but the juice was from concentrate and not fresh (a menu showed that fresh juice cost €5 extra). The woman at the reception when we arrived was nice and helpful and spoke English well. We asked her about the…

title: Great rooms, great location
review: Stayed here for 5 nights, never had lake view but quality of room superb! Room had settee and lots of space, large jacuzzi style bath and finished to a good standard. Cafe/restaurant attached to hotel served excellent food, even although sirmione is very busy this hotel is peaceful with its own jetty overlooking the lake.

title: Lovely visit to Sirmione
review: My partner booked the Flaminia Hotel because he had stayed there some years ago and remembered that he had liked the place. We were only there for a weekend at the end of April so we chose a room in the annex of the hotel that did not have a lake view because we did not expect to spend much time there (apart from at night). The room we were shown into was on the third floor with a large double bed, a whole wall of clothes cupboard, the window faced out toward the small lane outside and the sun shone in during the morning. The bathroom was large, very modern and tiled from floor to roof, very nice! We were very comfortable while we were in the room, slept well and enjoyed the bath with ever facility. Breakfast in the mornings was a buffet in the main hotel building next door with…

title: A slight step back in time but lovely.
review: Everything you need, a very small road through ancient alleys filled with tourists, (Smart cars a must) they then will park your car for you off the peninsular. There's a pontoon to swim off, really helpful staff, sensible breakfast, a room to iron your trousers in! (Much to the consternation of said staff who may not have seen an English man ironing.) Decor is 60s, almost fashionable again, charming, simple and we enjoyed it. Sirmione is in a similar backwater, some shops selling Chanel some selling copies. Lots of ice-cream parlours and lots of things you might buy and never use or keep out for a while on a mantelpiece until the next spring clean when it will end up in a box. We would come here again and to repeat all the staff were welcoming, helpful and efficient. Suitable…

title: Nice family trip
review: Second year running at this hotel. Was lucky this year and got a lake view room which was lovely. Great location on the lake with two sun terraces few mins from tons of restaurants. Nice hotel, service is good especially around the pool by the guys out there. Rooms were clean and nice my only criticism was the air con was not up to the job. Literally had to get up and shower in the night and sleep with wet towels so not pleasant however it was 38 degrees so maybe that was just too hot for it. Other than that lovely hotel. Breakfast is nice too.

title: Lock out
review: Nice hotel situated by the lake. The rooms are OK but you have to look out for the staff. Our waiter stole a pair of Gucci sunglasses worth 350 euro that was lying on our table . When we ask him to get the sunglasses back he denies there were any sunglasses on the table. We will not stay on this hotel again .

title: Beautiful Setting
review: Stayed for 2 nights in a nice room in the annexe, across the street from the main hotel. Room was clean and comfortable. Not lake view,  although we could see the lake by opening the windows and leaning round! It's in a great setting in the old part of the town, about a 5 minute walk from the bus stop and about 2 minutes from the ferries to other resorts. We ate in the Margherita Restaurant which is attached to the hotel which was very nice. There are loads of places to eat in the area so you are spoiled for choice. Breakfast was nice although the service wasn't that great and I had to ask for more coffee rather than being offered more. The beautiful location probably puts the price up, and overall this is a very nice hotel.

title: Perfect hotel
review: Perfeft hotel, very nice location in the old city, surrounded by dozens of cafe, pizzeria and etc. Rooms are clean, nice and well decorated. Lovely lake-views. Staff is very friendly and sociable. Reasonable price for a high quality. Hotel is suitable either for couples and for families with kids. We enjoyed staying here and looking forward for coming back soon.

title: Nice place
review: Hotel Flaminia is at an excellent location in Sirmione. The hotel is in nice condition, beautiful bathroom. It is an ideal place to discover old town. I did not know but you can actually drive up to the hotel to drop your bag and they show you to their reserved parking.

title: Great location, friendly service
review: We booked the Flaminia for a family weekend away in late May.  Check in was fast and friendly and staff throughout our stay were smiling and helpful. Rooms were a little dated in style but perfectly comfortable. The buffet breakfast was generous with a large selection of cereals, meats and cheeses etc plus platters of fresh fruit. The breakfast area gave access to the private lake terrace but unfortunately, due to the weather, we weren't able to make full use of this.  The hotel is located in the pedestrianised old town of Sirmione so there is easy access (on foot) to all the cafes, bars and restaurants. Despite its old town position you are allowed car access through the town gate when you first arrive - you can then leave your keys with reception to be parked elsewhere and…

title: Worst beds,  wonderful location!
review: Booked this hotel after reading good reviews, but nobody mentioned the beds!  Location in ideal, sirmione is a fairy tale village and this hotel is right in the middle, charming place.    Silvia was very helful.  Hotel is a four star,  however I believe this hotel is more like a three! we upgraded to lake view. however the pictures of the rooms in the web site are deceiving the rooms we  were given although spacious, were shabby, the furniture old and dated and the beds were very uncomfortable and worn out, our family suite, had a double, a small uncomfortable sofa bed and a small old camper bed, not adequate for two grown up children and unacceptable in a four star hotel, how do they get away with it?  Must be the views as they are to die for! Regardless this is unacceptable, …

title: Nice hotel in an excellent location
review: We had always wanted to visit Lake Garda and we decided to stay in Sirmione on the recommendation of friends who had also used the Flaminia Hotel. We opted for a suite which was on the top floor with a large French window that open up and had fantastic panoramic views of the lake and the little port below. The room itself was quite spacious with a very comfortable bed and the room, just like the rest of the hotel, was spotlessly clean. It had a sofa bed for two more guests as well as a small table and two chairs where we sat at night and watched the sun set over the lake. However, remember to close your window when it gets dark as the bugs get attracted to the lights and will fill your room!! There was a fridge as well as plenty of wardrobe space. The bathroom had a shower over…

title: Great staying
review: We were surprised by the location of the hotel since we needed to pass a gate and drive through narrow streets among tourists to be able to reach the hotel. Though a positive surprise. The hotel with it's own pier out in the lake Garda provided very good service and nice rooms. Since we were 4 people (2 adults and 2 teenagers) the hotel provided extra beds to reasonable price even though it was one of the most expensive nights at our Italy trip. Can highly recommend this hotel for more than one night since there are plenty of things to do like shopping, boat trips, bath, old buildings and even walking/running on the island.

title: Wonderful hotel on the lake
review: Beautiful lake Garda and a simply wonderful hotel. It is important to understand we had a room that overlooked the lake and waking up to that view every morning certainly notches up the overall experience.   In a nutshell:  Room was good View was outstanding  Sirmione beautiful  Lake beautiful   Getting there:  If you arrive by bus walk into the town and look out for hotel sirmione which will be on your left, Flaminia should be 3rd left after that.  Car: You can drive in but will need to follow instruction from police at the entrance to the town or follow the traffic lights. Be aware that the roads are narrow and Sirmione is geared towards the pedestrian. Be patient you will get through albeit slowly.  Hotel:  There are 2 sides to the hotel and we stayed in the annex, the room…

title: Stay here!
review: Just leaving after 6 wonderful nights at this hotel. We had a lake view room which was fantastic, I recommend it if you can.The decking area is perfect for relaxing for the whole day or an hour or two after a day of sightseeing around the lake.  Sirmione is a busy bustling town but you totally escape it here.  Breakfast is great with lots of choices Staff are extremly friendly and helpful.  We will be coming back!

title: Clean, spacious, very good breakfast.
review: Room was clean, airy and spacious. Good central location. The floor was not carpeted, so no musty smell in the room. Our room was a standard room (no lake view), it was probably not as well finished or fitted out as some other more superior rooms. It had mini bar and A/C. Bathroom could have been a bit nicer, but it was fine otherwise. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Wonderful selection at breakfast with a great view of the lake.

title: One of the best.................
review: Six of us stayed here for a week in June 2012. Location simply fabulous, lake views breathtaking, very friendly and efficient staff - family run - excellent breakfast on the terrace, nothing was too much trouble. Unhesitatingly recommended.

title: Paradise
review: My family and I have been staying at the Flaminia for many years it remains a wonderful holiday spot, I do not believe you could get a better position anywhere in the world. All of the staff ensure you have everything you need. Make sure you eat at Margharitas next door

title: Wonderful
review: We stayed in the Flaminia Hotel for part of our honeymoon and found it very relaxing. The location was perfect, right in the middle of Sirmione about a minute walk from the main jetty where you could get the boat to various other towns around the lake. The hotel has its own jetty on the lake filled with sun loungers and umberellas with waiter service and you could swim in the lake off the end of the jetty. The breakfast had a good selection with inside seating but still looking out onto the lake and the hotel also has it's own restaurant which we used at lunch time and found it to be reasonably priced. The bed was very comfortable and the room was very clean. We also used the laundry service as we had done quite a lot of travelling around Italy prior to our stay here and found…

title: Max Signori and staff are a delight
review: Hotel in the old town inside the castle gates, it's been family run for many years and the staff are a delight, comtemporary setting on the water. We enjoyed our stay.

title: Location location location
review: This is a "Sirmione 5 rating". i.e., don't expect a 5* hotel...  Stayed for 6 nights with a 4 year old (2nd time @ Sirmione). Location is great, in the middle of old town which is a beautiful "tourist trap" - being a tourist I'm ok with that :-) Sitting in the small balcony watching the lake and sipping some wine is just great. Going downstairs and being in the "middle", is also great. Rooms are a bit on the old side, but are being kept in perfect condition and are very clean. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Offered to change our original reservation of a Jr. Suite into two adjacent rooms to better accommodate our needs free of charge.  I do recommend for families with kids to take two connected rooms preferably with lake view. From our perspective only thing which…

title: Lovely hotel and great base
review: Recently stayed in Hotel Faminia, it is in a lovely location and the room was very comfortable and spacious.  The breakfast was ok, would have expected a lot more fresh fruit and juices considering its in a fruit growing country.  The breakfast room was lovely however.  The only complaint I have was with the night porter, who was the most unhelpful person I have ever met.  One night he was going to serve us in the bar, and half way throught the order he decided he was not serving any more and just closed the bar leaving some in the group without drink.  We were the only ones in the bar which leads me to believe they didn't want customers.  Overall The location and rooms in Hotel Flaminia are by far the best assets of this hotel

title: Wonderful base for wedding
review: I recently attended a family wedding in Sirmione and we had chosen the Hotel Flaminia as our base, we were not disappointed. The bride was due to get married from a different hotel however this changed when we saw the space and facilities in the Flaminia. The hotel staff were so accomodating and helpful. Some of our party had rooms 15 & 18 which were facing each other and were bright well air conditioned and spacious we were able to use one as our 'hairdressing room' and the other as a bridal dressing room. From the hotel was a short stroll to the Chapel and back down to the lake to board the boats to take us to the reception. I would definately stay in Hotel Flaminia if I go back to Sirmione. The choice at breakfast was great and it was very relaxing sitting at the lakeside…

title: Good hotel, reasonable price
review: Stayed here only one night during our road trip, but since this was our third time in Sirmione (and our fourth hotel in the old town) I must rank this one rather high on the list. We had a deluxe room without sea view, the room was huge! The bed very good and the interior (including the WC/shower) was modern, clean and seemed to be newly refurbished.   The hotels private jetty by the sea was a very good place to spend a couple of hours, soaking in the sun with the occasional cooling dip in the sea.   Breakfast not the best but ok. They charged an additional 4 EUR for a small glass of orange juice. Parking was outside the old town which could be a bit of a draw back but the walk to the parking took no more than 10 minutes (free).  Would recommend this hotel.

title: Great wedding location
review: Just returned from three nights in this hotel where we stayed for my friend's daughter's wedding.  The reception was at the restaurant next door (part of the hotel).  Our room had a lake view and was fairly spacious with a balcony big enough to sit on and enjoy the wonderful views.  The large bathroom even had a small balcony!  Whilst I would agree that the rooms could do with a bit of up dating, it was perfectly adequate.  The air conditioning worked well, the beds were comfortable but I have to agree with a previous reviewer that the pillows were very hard (the only down side).  I did ask for a softer one, but unfortunately it was still fairly solid.  All the staff were helpful and friendly, especially the reception.  At breakfast there was a good variety of food on offer…

title: Fantastic location
review: The best part of this hotel is the location, bang on the water and in the heart of town. The rooms are spacious, however, make sure that you get the newly renovated ones. The hotel lobby needs a spruce up and the carpets are old fashioned. However, I would stay here again simply because of the location which is one of the best in Sirmione.

title: Good Hotel
review: The hotel is located in the old town which is closed to cars due to very narrow "streets". However, with a hotel reservation, access will be granted (police check point) in order to drop off guests and baggage. After check-in, the hotel staff will volunteer to park the car outside the old town and return it to the hotel when needed, all free of charge. It takes less time (10 minutes) to walk to the car, than for the hotel to get it and fight the pedestrian traffic. The hotel is clean, but slightly dated. We stayed in the larger rooms which have the size of standard US hotel rooms. The beds were very comfortable, and the bathrooms were well stocked, except that there was no wash cloth were provided. A very large number of TV channels are available from many different countries,…

title: Perfect location and lake view
review: We stayed here for 4 nights leading up to the Easter weekend. Location wise this was perfect, in the centre of the old town so could walk to lots of restaurants for lunch and dinner. You can either park outside the old town and walk in or if you drive to the hotel, they will then park your car for you and bring it back. We booked a junior suite which was a good sized room at the top of the hotel with patio doors on two sides allowing for lovely uninterrupted views out onto the lake. Breakfast was good, although a little understaffed at times, suggest getting there early. Would stay again.

title: Number 1 in Sirmione for us!
review: It was all wonderful, from making the reservations directly through the internet, checking in, all the restaurant referrals and directions, and especially their own restaurant next door.  We had lakeview rooms with balconies and they were worth the premium.  The ferry around the lake was almost next door, there was parking, everyone was friendly and spoke easily in English (shame on our Italian).  We relaxed and yet had plenty to do. The breakfast was certainly among the better ones of our 18 day trip.  Thanks to all of you at the Flaminia for a very delightful stay.

title: Great small hotel with a perfect location in the old town
review: This is a great small hotel in a wonderful location, right on the lake in the old town. It is near the ferry dock but was not the least bit noisy. Staff was wonderful and very helpful.  We stayed in a junior suite located on the top floor and facing the lake. The added space was worth the extra cost. The room was clean and the bathroom was a good size and air conditioning worked well. Wifi was available in the room at no cost.....very much appreciated.  Breakfast was fairly typical and served in a room facing the water.....an added bonus.  One of the best features of the hotel was its 2 decks right on the water. This provided a feeling of spaciousness and always had lounges and umbrellas available. Drinks are served on the deck.  Although the hotel does not have parking on site,…

title: A fab weekend at Hotel flaminia sirmione, lake garda
review: Absolutely loved my weekend at hotel flaminia, Sirmione.  Perfectly positioned at the foot of the lake in the old town.  The staff were very helpful and the services in the restraunt outside was excellent as was the food.  Buffet breakfast good too.  The only negative I would make, we stayed in room 51, the pillows were as hard as rock and we both had difficulty sleeping on them.  The colours in the room felt too dark for such a small room and it felt a little like sleeping in a coffin.  Would have been much nicer if they were lighter and brighter.  Having said all that the rooms were clean and tidy.  Would it put me off going again.......probably not but I'd take my own pillow.!

title: Lovely view
review: We stayed in a standard lake view room. It had a (very) small balcony with space (just about) for two chairs.  The view from the balcony was lovely as it more or less hung out over the lake.  The room was fairly basic but was spotlessly clean.  The equally spotless shower room was the bathroom equivalent of a galley kitchen - long and narrow!  We didn't have much need to speak to or contact the Reception staff but when we did they were pleasant and helpful.  Breakfast was good but we did feel sorry for the lady who most days was on her own but who was responsible for topping up the buffet, bringing tea and coffee on request and clearing and setting up tables.  How she coped I do not know.  Lake Garda has become much dearer since our last visit a few years back.  We paid mega…

title: complete rip off, you wont get the room you booked and paid for
review: we stayed here for 4 nights last week and would never recommend this shambles of a hotel, upon entering  the room it was apparent that it was not the "superior double" that we had booked, we tried to explain this to the hotel but a  sudden, convienient lack of English was apparent. The air conditioning was not suficient and to make matters worse there were ongoing works on some of the rooms below which woke us up each morning by the banging and scraping the floor below. we paid EUR 175.00 per night for this apparent superior room despite as mentioning being given only a standard room, I have since complained to be met with the reponse of "oh we gave you a complimentary upgrade to a triple room and could have charged you more"!!!  i will never stay here again, being a veteran of…

title: Great location, basic, clean rooms
review: We recently stayed at Hotel Flaminia during a tour of the Italian lakes. The location, right in the heart of the historical town of Sirmione was superb - shops, restaurants & bars right on doorstep and being on the lakeside there are great views and access for swimming from the hotel terrace. We were in a standard room with lake view and the room was basic, but clean. Aircon struggled to keep the room cool but outside  temperature was very hot.  Parking is offered by the hotel but you need to drive through the historical centre to drop off luggage and then take car back to outside the 'castle walls'; This was more an inconvenience than anything else but was not made aware of this on website or hotel staff when booking. If you have a big car (4x4) then whilst the streets are just…

title: Fawlty Towers
review: I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights last week - we had a meal booked for two of these nights and it was a disaster on both nights.  We ordered drinks at the table and the waitresses insisted that we pay for each piece of the order as she gave it to us so I paid 4 times for our order of 8 drinks.  The waitress was on her own and unable to cope with the group of  40 people efficiently.   Breakfasts were ok.

title: The best place to stay in Sirmione
review: This is our second visit to Lake Garda.   We really can't fault the family run Hotel Flaminia.   Set in the old town on the edge of the lake, entirely peaceful, with very little  background noise.     Our room (23) of medium size, extremely comfortable with a small balcony from which we would watch the coming and going of the ferries, plus other activities on the lake.   The cleanliness was exceptional - fresh towels and pillowcases daily and sheets every other day.   Breakfasts were of good quality continental standard - and eggs, bacon and sausage available most days. The hotel is within reach of many cafes and restaurants.  Our favourite snack bar was Antiche Mura, in the road opposite Flaminia Piazza and served the best bruchette you've ever tasted.  Two restaurants stood…

title: Bring a torch
review: I agree with all the positive things that have been said about this hotel, and my only criticism is the gloomy lighting in the room which makes it impossible to read after dark unless you lay on the bed and tun a reading light on. I even took off the wall light shade to try to lighten things up. It wasn't the end of the world and I didn't mention it to the staff (maybe I should have) and perhaps we were just unlucky with the room.  Anyway, apart from that we had a great time except for the weather, but the hotel supply plentiful umbrellas!

title: Great Hotel, Excellent Service, Beautiful Location!
review: Due to a change in our programme we arrived in Sirmione two days earlier than planned and therefore had no prior booking at this hotel. We arrived at just before midnight and luckily got a room for the night. We were so pleased with our room and the hotel in general that we ended up staying all six nights here while we were in Sirmione. The room was fantastic and the deck area was a great place to sunbathe and take a dip in the beautiful lake Garda. We didn't miss a swimming pool at all. The restuarant served great food and the location of the hotel is perfect.  The lovely ladies of Hotel Flaminia were ever so helpful throughout our stay. The hotel is run by a mother and daughter duo and together with a very helpful and pleasant team of other ladies (and gents) they offered…

title: Great location, very nice hotel
review: Hotel Flaminia turned out to be even better than expected. Its location in Sirmione was better than great. This town is simply gorgeous and so much fun. The hotel is located in the heart of the town, making it so convenient to walk to everything, yet just far enough off the main street to be quiet and offer divine lake views. Definitely book a room with at least a partial view of the lake (see our photos). It's a bit hard to find within the town, which is closed to all traffic except those with reservations. But once you get there through the crowded cobblestone streets, you don't have to take the car out again and will find wonderful shops, restaurants and scenery. Breakfast outside, lakeside, was the best we had in Italy with all sorts of wonderful meats, cheeses, eggs,…

title: nice room - pity about the noise
review: We were upgraded on arrival at Hotel Flaminia to a superior room in the annexe because we had paid Bath Travel £50 each for a balcony/lake view.  Great room with 3 piece suite, great big bed and nice decorations.  Unfortunately the kitchens serving the Flaminia restaurant, pub and pizzeria were right below us and the noise was incessant all evening and late into the night.  Add to that 5am deliveries and bin emptying and you can guess how much sleep we got.  Sirmione is deluged with day trippers every day, particularly hordes of Italian school children so it's best to get on a ferry and go somewhere else during the day.

title: Excellent find, ten out of ten !
review: We have just returned from four lovely days in Lake Garda which was only enhanced by this lovely hotel.  Take a taxi direct from train station Desenzano, they are few and far between but we were very lucky and got one on arrival.  A short taxi drive takes you to the busy streets of Sirmione.   Check in was the quickest we have ever experienced, we were in our room in no time with our bags brought up to the room by the ever obliging hotel staff.  Our room was lovely, on the side of the hotel, perfect size and large bathroom and our room had an amazing view of the lake.  The sun was just setting over the lake as we arrived. The breakfast was generous and service very prompt.  Plenty of hot and cold foods.  Hotel staff were very helpful advising us on trips and tours, also had free…

title: Great Hotel
review: We stayed for 2 weeks at the Hotel Flaminia in May 2008.  We had emailed the hotel on a few ocassions prior to arriving to arrange airport transfers etc and found them to be extremely helpful and prompt with responses.  We were picked up at Brescia airport - right on time.  No problems.    Our room was on the top floor with a huge floor to ceiling window overlooking the lake.  It was gorgeous.  The room was very spacious and had a king size bed, sofa bed, table & chairs, desk, mini fridge and TV.  It has obviously been newly decorated.  We used the restaurant attached to the hotel once.  No problems but there are other much nicer restaurants in Sirmione.  The breakfast was lovely.  Plenty of variety.  A few times they had run out of hot food by the time we got down but you just…

title: Would stay here again
review: Had just a week at this lovely little hotel. We were put in the newly decorated "feng shui" wing, large bedroom with slightly weird decor and beatifully appointed bathroom but as building is slightly set back does not give a full view of the lake. Returned to the desk clerk who was very helpful and though couldn't move us immediately did so very efficiently the next day to room in older part of the hotel, more traditional but perfectly comfortable and great view with little balcony so we were able to watch all the comings and goings of the ferries. The ferry stop is two minutes walk and a great way of getting to see all the other resorts on the lake. Sirmione is traffic free, lively,and perfect for people watching. Lots of restaurants, the one attached to the hotel pretty good…

title: Ideal location, good service.
review: Arriving 20:00 at Desenzano station with the 18:03 train from Mestre, we should "just take a taxi" to Sirmione (10 km) with our two heavy suitcases. Standing in line for quite a while, frequently calling the number on the taxi sign, we finally called Flaminia for help.  The answer was "No problem, me fix" - and half an hour later their Bellboy the Allrounder came with his brand new hotel car - and swoop - we entered Flaminia, certainly after tacking through old Sirmiones narrow streets (read corridors). Located directly on the waterfront, we had a front room with a small balcony overlooking most of Lake Gardas southwestern "corner". Quite frequently passenger boats of varying type and size - including two Mississippi type wheel steamers - came in to the quay just 200 m from…

title: Excellent
review: We stayed at the Flaminia first week in Sept. We had a standard room with side lake view (you can upgrade to a room on the front of the hotel, however you are only 2 minutes away from the sundeck which has the same view) The room was spacious & clean with a good bathroom. The breakfast each morning was great, with a good selection & the added bonus of looking out over the lake while you eat. The location of the Hotel puts you right in the middle of all the action, 5 minutes from the ferry dock and bus station. There are plenty of restaurants & bars all within strolling distance (including the Hotels own restaurant) The staff were all very helpful & friendly. The sundeck was fantastic, you can take a dip in the lake, sunbathe or just check out the sunset. Great Hotel.

title: quite nice
review: We were pleased with this hotel.  Our room was very obviously recently refurbished----modern furnishings are not my favourite style, but it was nicely and thoughtfully done.  The room was very large by European standards; we had plenty of room even for our massive amount of luggage.  The spacious bathroom also was brand-new and very stylish, and included a jacuzzi bathtub.  There was no coffee/tea service in the room, but breakfast in the nice room overlooking the lake is included in the price.

title: Nice Surprise
review: What a pleasant surprise!  Some of the reviews made me cautious in booking but the hotel is very nice.  The ride in from the Desenzano Rai Station was disheartening as the south part of Lake Garda is overbuilt.  But our spirits lifted as we progressed up the narrow peninsula and got to the minimal auto zone over the moat bridge where we found ourselves in a living monument.  The hotel rooms are done in what I'd call that clean, swiss style.  Nice recent tilework in the bathroom and parquet floors in the room.  Our rooms, 37 and 38, overlooked the lake with a beautiful western view.  One also sees the adjacent ferry.  Decks over the water on the lakeside of the hotel allow sunning and snoozing.  Just inside this deck area, the eating tables are positioned for breakfast with a…

title: Loved it !!
review: Hotel Flaminia, Sirmione 4* B & B  Superb location, situated close to the ferries, countless restaurants and bars within yards of the hotel.  The hotel is bright and spacious and immaculately clean, much attention being paid to keep it that way daily.  Be sure to get a room with a full front view of Lake Garda with a balcony, rooms 37 and 38.  Other superior rooms look out onto the ally, or air conditioning units.  Some have partial lake views, others none at all even though they are superior.  Our room was spacious and stylishly furnished, although we could not hear our TV as the volume was permanently on low – perhaps it was set that way so as not to upset adjoining guest rooms.  Our en suite bathroom was adequate, although probably done out in the 70’s judging by the tiles…

title: Ideal location
review: Because of the location of this hotel amid traffic-free zone (though residential/delivery traffic passes through), on arrival we walked to the hotel from the bus station (about 10 minutes).  The Flaminia is ideally located and from our lakeview balcony we could watch all the comings and goings on the lake, including the ferry station which is only 5 minutes' walk away.  The room was quite small but adequate; the most annoying thing about it was the location of the wardrobe which was so close to the TV and fridge that you couldn't actually open the wardrobe door properly!  Very bad planning!  The bathroom/shower room was clean and relatively new.  As we arrived in a heatwave of 36 plus temperatures, the efficient air-con was very welcome.  The breakfast was good and service…

title: Cancellation Woes
review: We never actually made it to the Hotel Flaminia, although we had made reservations well in advance for April 2004.  Unfortunately, we had to cancel our trip and I faxed my cancellation instructions to the hotel TWO WEEKS prior to our trip.  I never heard back from them until I received notice that my credit card had been charged for the room.  I then wrote them a letter, including a copy of my previous fax.  I received no response.  I finally had to take the matter up with my credit card company to get the charge removed.  We have rescheduled our trip for 2005, but we will not be making reservations at the Hotel Flaminia.
